lessons.title: Different Types of Structure
lessons.content: Engine structure is one of the most fundamental aspects of automotive engineering, defining both performance characteristics and the distinct sound profile of a vehicle. The main types include:

lessons.title: How a Cat-Back Exhaust Affects Sound
lessons.content: A cat-back exhaust system refers to the portion of the exhaust system from the catalytic converter to the exhaust tips. It plays a crucial role in determining your car's sound profile.

points.title: Louder Volume
points.description: Aftermarket cat-back systems often use larger diameter pipes and less restrictive mufflers/resonators, allowing exhaust gases to flow more freely. This results in a louder, more pronounced exhaust note compared to stock systems.

points.title: Deeper or Sharper Tone
points.description: Cat-back systems with resonators produce a smoother, deeper tone, while those without resonators sound sharper and raspier.

points.title: More Aggressive Character
points.description: Many performance cat-back systems are tuned to emphasize a sporty or race-inspired sound, with more crackles, pops, or backfires depending on the car and setup.

points.title: Active Exhaust Valves
points.description: Some cat-back systems feature active exhaust valves that let drivers switch between quiet and aggressive sound modes, offering both comfort and performance at the push of a button or automatically based on driving conditions.

quiz.question: What type of engine is this?
Which of the following factors will not affect engine sound?
